result.execSummary:
The defendant Bret C Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted payment plan for court costs in the amount of $50 per mo commencing 6/1/2014. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered.

Defendant Bret C Bennett in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Defendant in custody. Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint and penalties thereof. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Defendant requests SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court adjourns for further proceedings, at that date, court will schedule a jury trial. Bail to continue.
Status hearing on March 3, 2014 at 08:45 am.

(Br 3 sitting for Br 1) Defendant Bret C Bennett in court, in custody.    Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Atty Wilfred DeJunco appears as a friend of the court stating defendant will not qualify for representation. Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he may be hiring private counsel. Counsel waives reading. Court finds probable cause. Counsel has waived extradition from Colorado where he was arrested on this warrant.  State requests $1000.00 cash bail. Counsel requesting timelimits be waived and status hearing be set.
